title: Hear How Takeoff and the Migos Flow Changed Atlanta Rap
description: Quick-jabbing triplets had been a staple of rap, but the trio made the style sound fresh, thanks in large part to Takeoff, its master of syncopation. The rapper was shot and killed at 28 on Tuesday.
dc:creator: Jon Caramanica
media:credit: Chad Batka for The New York Times
media:description: From left: Takeoff, Quavo and Offset of Migos. The Atlanta group favored tightly clustered syllables that helped change the sound of the cityâ€™s influential rap scene.
